contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Belgium Municipality |name=Dessel |picture= |picture-legend= |map=DesselLocatie.png |map-legend=Location of Dessel in the province of Antwerp |arms=Coat of arms of Dessel.jpg |flag=Flag of Dessel.svg |region={{BE-REG-FLE}} |community={{BE-NL}} |province={{BE-PROV-AN}} |arrondissement=[[Arrondissement of Turnhout|Turnhout]] |nis=13006 |pyramid-date= |0-19= |20-64= |65= |foreigners= |foreigners-date= |mayor=[[Kris Van Dijck]] (N-VA) |majority=N-VA |postal-codes=2480 |telephone-area=014 |web=[http://www.dessel.be www.dessel.be] |lat_deg=51 |lat_min=14 |lon_deg=05 |lon_min=07 }} '''Dessel''' is a [[municipality]] located in the [[Belgium|Belgian]] province of [[Antwerp (province)|Antwerp]]. The municipality comprises only the town of Dessel proper. On January 1, 2013 Dessel had a total population of 9.300 inhabitants. The total area is 27.03 km² which gives a [[population density]] of 325 inhabitants per km². ==Nuclear industries== Dessel hosts several nuclear facilities: * Belgoprocess, ex Eurochemic reprocessing plant (OECD), now in charge of the operational waste management for [[ONDRAF|Ondraf/Niras]]. * BelgoNucléaire, an old MOX factory, presently closed and to be decommissioned in the future. * [[Franco-Belge de Fabrication du Combustible]] (FBFC) making nuclear fuel assemblies; * The Dessel site was selected in June 2006 by the Belgian government to construct the first shallow land disposal facility for low-level radioactive waste in Belgium. The decision was taken after consultation of the local authorities and the population in the frame of the Stola consultation group. ==Sport== The town has two [[football (soccer)|football]] clubs: * K.F.C. Witgoor Sport, which plays in the Belgian Fourth Division. * [[K.F.C. Dessel Sport]], which plays in the Belgian Second Division. ==Events== [[Image:Graspop 2008.JPG|thumb|left|[[In Flames]] performs at Graspop 2008 ]] * [[Graspop Metal Meeting]], yearly [[heavy metal music]] festival. ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.dessel.be Official website] - Available only in [[Dutch language|Dutch]] *[http://www.eurochemic.be/eng/index-eng.html Eurochemic] *[http://www.eurochemic.be/nl/documents/68-eurochemic-EN.pdf Eurochemic 1956-1990, European Company for the Chemical Processing of Irradiated Fuels], Jean-Marc Wolff, OECD Historical Series, 1999 {{Antwerpen Belgium}} [[Category:Municipalities of Antwerp (province)]] {{Antwerp-geo-stub}}
